Marlow's Listener not having to think about what you are going to say when you can decently interrupt

It can never be just one lie

04 Jan 2015

unless you have an indefinitely extensible repertoire of ways to use your candidate belief (if that is what it is) in different contexts, it is not a belief in any remotely recognizable sense.

Daniel Dennett, Intuition Pumps and Other Tools for Thinking

Reynold's Number

28 Jan 2013

I have no quarrel with time.
I float, flow, will sink, not sync.
Time herself has the indifference
Of a schoolboyâ€™s secret crush,
We stand invisible in suspense
That perhaps the usual rules
Will be suspended, in our case,
And the surprise will be more time,
Time long after we weary of it
As we wearied of childhood and
Its fabled happiness of endless
August cut off from recess.
